d10,d100 0 1 0 Armor glitches

1 0 1 Armor abilities don't function. All remaining charges are drained. 2 3 Armor* seizes up and abilities don't function. The wearer is paralyzed for 1 round. *For a shield, the shield's wielder is not impeded by the glitch. 5 6 Armor doesn't function, but still consumes the normal number of charges. 10 11 Armor doesn't function, but no charges are lost. 18 19 Armor uses twice as many charges as normal (or expends an extra activation's worth of charges if already active). 50 51 Armor functions normally. 75 76 Armor functions better than anticipated. Its armor bonus improves by 1 for the duration of this charge. 80 81 Armor functions much better than anticipated. Its armor bonus improves by 2 and it provides moderate fortification (Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook 463) for the duration of this charge. 90 91 Armor functions normally; no charges are consumed by this use. 98 99 Armor functions normally and a power surge restores 1d6 charges to the item (up to but not exceeding its capacity). 100

Timeworn pharmaceuticals have a chance of glitching when the dose is administered, even if another dose was recently used effectively. d10,d100 0 1 0 Pharmaceutical glitches

1 0 1 Spoiled. Treat as poisoning by dark reaver powder. 2 3 Spoiled. Treat as exposure to red ache. 11 12 Spoiled. Patient is nauseated for 1d6 rounds. 20 21 Spoiled. Patient sickened for 1d6 × 10 minutes. 30 31 Spoiled. No effect. 40 41 Less potent. Decrease all save DCs by 2*. Use minimum values for all random results (such as healing). Decrease durations by 50%. * For a cardioamp, decrease the save DCs on a more potent result, and increase the save DCs on a less potent result. 50 51 Normal effect, but causes 1d4 points of Constitution damage (Fortitude DC 15 half). 60 61 Normal effect, but hallucinogenic (-5 penalty on Perception checks and confused for 2d4 rounds, Fortitude DC 15 negates). 75 76 Normal effect. 85 86 More potent. Increase any save DCs by 2*. Reroll any result of 1. Increase durations by 100%. * For a cardioamp, decrease the save DCs on a more potent result, and increase the save DCs on a less potent result. 95 96 Far more potent. As above, but treat as 2 doses. 100

Items other than armor, pharmaceuticals, or weapons use this general glitch table. d10,d100 0 1 0 General glitches

1 0 1 Item does not function. All remaining charges are drained. 2 99 Item functions normally and a power surge restores 1d6 charges to the item. 100 91 Item functions normally and this use does not consume any charges. 98 81 Item functions far better than anticipated, and grants a +2 bonus on any skill check attempted with this use. 90 76 Item functions better than anticipated, and grants a +1 bonus on any skill check attempted with this use. 80 51 Item functions normally. 75 19 Item uses twice as many charges as normal, but otherwise functions normally. 50 11 Item uses twice as many charges as normal and jolts the user for 1d6 points of electricity damage, but otherwise functions normally. 18 6 Item does not function, but no charges are lost. 10 3 Item does not function, but still consumes the normal number of charges. 5

Weapons used to make more than one attack in a turn might glitch multiple times during that turn. d10,d100 0 0 0 Weapon glitches

1 0 1 Weapon does not function. All remaining charges are drained. 2 3 Weapon does not function, but sti l l consumes the normal number of charges. 24 25 Weapon consumes twice as many charges as normal and deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per charge consumed (minimum 1 d 6) to the user. 39 40 Weapon consumes twice as many charges as normal. 65 66 Weapon functions normally but flashes brightly, blinding the wielder and adjacent creatures for 1 round (Reflex DC 15 negates). 75 76 Weapon functions normally. 84 85 Weapon functions better than anticipated, granting a +2 bonus on attack rolls made with that weapon for 1 round. 92 93 Weapon functions much better than anticipated, granting a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. 96 97 Weapon functions normally, and this use does not consume any charges. 98 99 Weapon functions normally, and a power surge restores 1d6 charges to the item (up to but not exceeding its capacity). 100
